cold_snaps.status: No cold snap is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference remains 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for total rainfall, today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The highest ranked rain rate was registered today with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.99mm of rain fell during the storm's 2.0 hours length.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 23 November 2024, it lasted 23.2 hours, delivered 24.56mm of rain at a maximum rate of 6.4mm per hour.
We are currently experiencing a storm.  This is the first such event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting so far started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 5th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (203°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 75.74 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1549 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 42.7m higher than yesterday, 445.2m lower than the past week, 1549.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 1109.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1554.8m and 2660m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Light to moderate rain is forecast, occasional overcast conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather could become unsettled.
